you can play the video right on the site
let's get into the economic collapse

been looking at the economy and we've

day now during Obama's presidency he was
out there telling us that this is how
the recovery is we know that the BLS and
the rest of the agencies have been
manipulating a lot of these numbers we
started to realize that the unemployment
number made no sense whatsoever other
individuals started to jump on board
where they were outspoken thing yet
these numbers make no sense whatsoever
and then we sort of look at what was
really going on in the economy with

restaurants and everything else and we
notice that the economy is actually
contracting on itself not expanding
during a recovery during the good times
in an economy the economy expands it
grows people get better paying jobs
retail expands more stores open but
we're seeing the opposite right now and
we're starting to see these bubbles
start to pop and everything that we've
been talking about corporate defaults
we've been talking about how the market
has been rigged how precious metals has
been written that's been proven because
of the investigation and lawsuits
against certain banks we're starting to
see that all of this is starting to come
down around the manipulation and we're
starting to see that the economy is
starting to implode on itself I mean
just look
retail right now now i remember when i
started reporting on retail on how each
holiday season they were getting worse
and worse as time went on and it made no

dropping from ten percent to nine
percent and of course these are the
manipulating numbers that the government
put out there but we'll go with those
numbers and it kept falling during the
time period and more people were getting

same rate it makes no sense whatsoever
then we started to realize ah they
manipulated the unemployment rate those
people who have fallen off we haven't
been on an interview for four weeks they
just don't count them anymore they've
given up they don't want to make a
living they don't want to make money for

sense doesn't it no what's really
happening here is they had to keep the
illusion alive and ahead of explain away
why all this was happening now they
started out with the weather this is why
retail is not doing well during the
holiday season during the spring during
the summer and that kind of fell apart
because how many times can you use it
when retail continually falls apart and
what we're seeing today is that it is
accelerating at a pace that we've never

luring sales no it's not all of these

see from these huge stores like fears
well they're rapidly deteriorating
falling apart right now it looks like
Sears is going to be cutting senior

they completely fall apart we know in
the beginning of 2017 there was going to
be about 3500 store
that would be closing well that number
has now jumped much much higher actually

their calculations on a unit basis
approximately two thousand eight hundred
eighty store closings were announced

roughly sixty percent of store closure

estimates that there could be more than
8640 store closings this year which will

which suggests that brick and mortar

accelerating and it's going to be a

Goods chain gander mountain and many

already and this compares with nine

though people believe that online sales
well that is most of the retail

all of this is that as all these stores

remember how they calculate sales for

don't just say okay you know what let's

millions of square feet that are going

hundred and forty seven million square

2001 so at this point we are seeing that
this retail bubble is popping the
commercial real estate bubble that is
going to be a complete disaster and this
will have a domino effect on the rest of

now those balls that are compared are
basically trying to survive right now
they are doing whatever they possibly

is no traffic is coming into the malls
and this is because people don't have
the
funds to go out shopping either in the

it's not working and we have to remember

it's driven by government because you

they're boring against a credit card
using that money to give people jobs
using that money or should say currency
to purchase goods and this is how
they've been keeping the economy afloat
now this is going to come to an end
whether we like it or not because it

this will continue forever if you've
never been in this situation before
you'll don't realize how things actually
do come to an end it cannot go on
forever because when your revenue base

cannot continue forever this is a proven

know why we've had all these recessions

this has all been caused by the central
bank it has been caused
by those individuals who are in control
they bring down the economy this is why
you need us you need us to manage the
the currency you need you need us to
manage the economy of the government of

this is what they continually do to
prove why we need the central bank to
show that they have full control of what
is going on here now Charles Schwab came

interesting they announced that the
number of new brokerage accounts sword
forty-four percent during the first
quarter of 2017 now people might be
looking at this saying WOW the markets
doing well people are getting into it
but more specifically Schwab stated that
individual investors are opening up
stock trading accounts at the fastest
pace the company has seen in 17 years
now to me when I look at this this is a
classic bubble scenario the last time we
saw this 17 years ago was the dot-com
bubble burst and what we saw was the
stock market rising very high the
insiders selling off their stocks the
retail investor coming in and purchasing
those stocks and we are seeing the same
thing actually it happens in housing to
where the insiders they purchase as many
houses they possibly can and then they
start selling them off to retail
investors because they pumped up the
bubble they pump it up far enough where
people think wow housing is going to
continually move up there speculators
the mom and pop speculator who says you
know something I'm going to get into
housing right now i'm going to start
flipping the first couple of times it
works out very very well and they
continually do it they hold on to a
couple of houses they expand their
businesses and they purchase one two
three four homes they start redoing
those and then what happens is the
market comes down and we're starting to
see this not just in the housing but in
the stock market also and if we look
back going back to the dot-com bubble
investors were rushing in to open new
brokerage accounts and invest their
savings in the stock market because why
they saw that while the markets going up
dot-com is the wave of the future it's
basically all created to bring in the

dollars of wealth from the retail
investor the last phase of any bubble is
almost invariably your fork shopping

at record highs believing that prices

what happened during the dot-com bubble
this is what we're seeing right now and
if we look at what happened in 2008 what
wiii happen in two thousand and all
